symptoms: Brown spots with concentric rings on older leaves, yellowing and dying leaves, dark lesions on stems
prevention: Use disease-resistant varieties. Rotate crops annually. Water at the base of plants, avoiding wetting leaves. Apply mulch to prevent soil splash.
treatment: Remove infected leaves immediately. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Ensure proper spacing between plants for air circulation.

symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves, stems, and fruits. Rapid spread in cool, wet conditions
prevention: Plant disease-resistant varieties. Avoid overhead watering. Ensure good air circulation. Monitor weather conditions.
treatment: Remove and destroy all infected plants immediately. Apply fungicides containing mefenoxam or chlorothalonil. Do not compost infected material.

symptoms: Small, circular spots with dark borders and light centers on leaves. Can cause defoliation
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid working with wet plants. Remove plant debris at season end.
treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper. Improve air circulation around plants.

symptoms: Small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves, stems, and fruits with yellow halos. Causes leaf drop
prevention: Use disease-free seeds and transplants. Rotate crops. Avoid working with wet plants. Sanitize tools between uses.
treatment: Remove infected plant parts. Apply copper-based bactericides. Avoid overhead irrigation.

symptoms: Yellowing and wilting of lower leaves, brown discoloration in vascular tissue, plant death
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Rotate crops with non-host plants. Avoid planting in infected soil.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants. Solarize soil. Use biological control agents like Trichoderma.

symptoms: Yellowing leaves starting from bottom, wilting during day, brown vascular discoloration
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Rotate with non-susceptible crops. Maintain soil pH around 6.5.
treatment: Remove infected plants. Solarize soil. Use resistant rootstocks for grafting.

symptoms: Mottled light and dark green patterns on leaves, leaf distortion, stunted growth
prevention: Use virus-free seeds. Control aphids and whiteflies. Disinfect tools. Remove weeds.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants. No chemical treatment available. Use resistant varieties.

symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings on leaves, premature defoliation, reduced tuber yield
prevention: Use certified disease-free seed potatoes. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead irrigation. Apply mulch.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Remove infected foliage. Ensure proper plant spacing.

symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems, white fungal growth in humid conditions, tuber rot
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid overhead irrigation. Ensure good drainage. Monitor weather.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing mancozeb or chlorothalonil. Remove infected plants immediately.

symptoms: Rough, scabby lesions on potato tubers, corky texture, reduced market value
prevention: Maintain soil pH between 5.0-5.2. Use resistant varieties. Rotate crops. Avoid fresh manure.
treatment: No effective treatment once infected. Focus on prevention through soil management.

symptoms: Black, slimy rot at base of stem, wilting, yellowing leaves, soft rot in tubers
prevention: Use certified seed potatoes. Avoid planting in wet soil. Practice crop rotation.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants. Apply copper-based fungicides. Improve drainage.

symptoms: Yellow-orange pustules arranged in stripes along wheat leaves, reduced grain yield
prevention: Plant rust-resistant varieties. Monitor fields regularly. Apply preventive fungicides. Remove volunteer wheat.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing tebuconazole, propiconazole, or azoxystrobin. Early treatment is crucial.

symptoms: Brown, elongated lesions on wheat leaves starting at tips, reduced photosynthesis
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Practice crop rotation. Avoid excessive nitrogen. Ensure proper drainage.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing propiconazole or tebuconazole. Remove infected plant debris after harvest.

symptoms: Bleached spikelets, pink or orange fungal growth, shriveled grains, reduced yield
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Rotate crops. Avoid planting wheat after corn. Time planting to avoid flowering during wet weather.
treatment: Apply fungicides at flowering stage. Use products containing tebuconazole or prothioconazole.

symptoms: White, powdery fungal growth on leaves and stems, yellowing leaves, reduced photosynthesis
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure proper spacing. Avoid excessive nitrogen. Monitor humidity.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing propiconazole or tebuconazole. Remove infected plant parts.

symptoms: Brown, elongated lesions on leaves, reduced photosynthesis, grain yield loss
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Practice proper water management. Avoid excessive nitrogen. Remove infected debris.
treatment: Apply appropriate fungicides or bactericides based on pathogen type. Improve field drainage.

symptoms: Diamond-shaped lesions on leaves, node rot, empty panicles, significant yield loss
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid excessive nitrogen. Maintain proper water levels. Use balanced fertilization.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing tricyclazole, propiconazole, or azoxystrobin. Treat at early stages.

symptoms: Oval or irregular lesions on leaf sheaths, white fungal growth, lodging of plants
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Maintain proper spacing. Avoid excessive nitrogen. Practice crop rotation.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing validamycin or propiconazole. Remove infected plant debris.

symptoms: Water-soaked streaks on leaves turning brown, yellowing, reduced grain filling
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Avoid overhead irrigation. Practice crop rotation. Remove weeds.
treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides. Remove infected plant parts. Improve field drainage.

symptoms: Angular, water-soaked spots on cotton leaves turning brown, defoliation, yield impact
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Rotate crops. Use disease-free seeds. Sanitize equipment.
treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides. Remove and destroy infected plant parts. Avoid overhead irrigation.

symptoms: Yellowing and wilting of leaves, brown vascular discoloration, plant death
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Rotate crops. Avoid planting in infected soil. Improve drainage.
treatment: Remove infected plants. Solarize soil. Use biological control agents.

symptoms: Yellowing leaves, wilting, brown vascular tissue, reduced yield
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Rotate with non-host crops. Maintain proper soil pH.
treatment: Remove infected plants. Solarize soil. Use resistant cultivars.

symptoms: Circular black spots with fringed edges on leaves, yellowing, leaf drop
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Water at base, not on leaves. Ensure good air circulation. Remove fallen leaves.
treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil, myclobutanil, or neem oil.

symptoms: White, powdery spots on leaves, stems, and buds, distorted growth
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure proper spacing. Water at base. Prune for air flow.
treatment: Remove infected parts. Apply fungicides containing sulfur, neem oil, or potassium bicarbonate.

symptoms: Orange or reddish pustules on undersides of leaves, yellow spots on upper surface
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure good air circulation. Remove infected leaves. Avoid overhead watering.
treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing myclobutanil or propiconazole.

symptoms: Sunken, dark spots on fruits and leaves, fruit rot, significant yield loss in humid conditions
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead watering. Ensure proper spacing.
treatment: Remove infected fruits and leaves. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or azoxystrobin.

symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves turning brown, leaf drop, reduced yield
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid working with wet plants. Sanitize tools.
treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides. Remove infected plant parts. Avoid overhead irrigation.

symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on stems, wilting, fruit rot, plant collapse
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Improve drainage. Avoid overhead irrigation. Practice crop rotation.
treatment: Remove infected plants. Apply fungicides containing mefenoxam or metalaxyl. Improve drainage.

symptoms: Long, elliptical gray-green lesions on leaves, reduced photosynthesis, yield loss
prevention: Plant resistant hybrids. Rotate crops. Remove crop residue. Use balanced fertilization.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing propiconazole or azoxystrobin. Treat at early stages.

symptoms: Reddish-brown pustules on leaves, yellowing, reduced grain fill
prevention: Plant resistant hybrids. Rotate crops. Remove volunteer corn plants.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing propiconazole or tebuconazole if infection is severe.

symptoms: Rectangular, tan to gray lesions on leaves, premature death, yield reduction
prevention: Plant resistant hybrids. Rotate crops. Remove crop residue. Avoid excessive nitrogen.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole. Treat preventively.

symptoms: Small, tan to reddish-brown pustules on leaves, defoliation, yield loss
prevention: Plant early-maturing varieties. Monitor fields regularly. Apply preventive fungicides.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin, propiconazole, or tebuconazole. Early treatment is key.

symptoms: Circular, tan spots with dark borders on leaves, premature defoliation
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Rotate crops. Remove crop residue. Avoid excessive nitrogen.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole if infection is severe.

symptoms: Angular, water-soaked spots on leaves turning brown, defoliation
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid working with wet plants. Sanitize equipment.
treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides. Remove infected plant parts.

symptoms: Yellow angular spots on upper leaf surface, gray fuzzy growth on underside, defoliation
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure good air circulation. Avoid overhead watering. Use drip irrigation.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing mancozeb, chlorothalonil, or copper-based products.

symptoms: White, powdery spots on leaves and stems, yellowing, reduced yield
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure proper spacing. Water at base. Improve air circulation.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing sulfur, neem oil, or potassium bicarbonate.

symptoms: Wilting of leaves starting from tips, ooze from cut stems, plant death
prevention: Control cucumber beetles. Use resistant varieties. Rotate crops. Remove infected plants.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants immediately. Control insect vectors.

symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruits, leaf drop, fruit lesions
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead irrigation. Sanitize tools.
treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides. Remove infected plant parts.

symptoms: Dark lesions on stems, wilting, fruit rot, plant collapse
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Improve drainage. Avoid overhead irrigation. Practice rotation.
treatment: Remove infected plants. Apply fungicides containing mefenoxam. Improve drainage.

symptoms: Sunken, dark spots on fruits, fruit rot, yield loss
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead watering. Remove crop debris.
treatment: Remove infected fruits. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or azoxystrobin.

symptoms: Reddish-brown pustules on leaves and pods, defoliation, yield reduction
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Rotate crops. Remove crop residue. Avoid overhead irrigation.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing propiconazole or tebuconazole if infection is severe.

symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves turning brown, angular lesions, defoliation
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid working with wet plants.
treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides. Remove infected plant parts.

symptoms: Dark, sunken lesions on pods and leaves, seed discoloration
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead irrigation. Remove crop debris.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or azoxystrobin.

symptoms: Yellow V-shaped lesions on leaf margins, black veins, wilting
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead irrigation. Remove crop debris.
treatment: Remove infected plants. Apply copper-based bactericides. Practice crop rotation.

symptoms: Swollen, distorted roots, stunted growth, wilting, plant death
prevention: Use resistant varieties. Maintain soil pH above 7.0. Rotate crops. Improve drainage.
treatment: Remove infected plants. Lime soil to raise pH. Use resistant cultivars.

symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaves, gray fuzzy growth on underside, defoliation
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure good air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing mancozeb or chlorothalonil.

symptoms: Brown spots on leaves with yellow halos, defoliation, reduced root quality
prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead irrigation. Remove crop debris.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb.

symptoms: Soft, watery rot on roots, foul odor, plant collapse
prevention: Improve drainage. Avoid overwatering. Practice crop rotation. Handle roots carefully.
treatment: Remove infected plants. Improve soil drainage. Use proper storage conditions.

symptoms: Yellow streaks on leaves, gray fuzzy growth, leaf collapse
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure good air circulation. Avoid overhead irrigation.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing mancozeb or chlorothalonil.

symptoms: Purple lesions on leaves with yellow halos, leaf dieback, bulb rot
prevention: Use disease-free sets. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead irrigation. Remove crop debris.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb.

symptoms: Yellowing leaves, white fluffy growth on bulbs, soft rot, plant death
prevention: Use disease-free sets. Rotate crops for 4-5 years. Improve drainage.
treatment: Remove infected plants. Solarize soil. Use fungicidal treatments.

symptoms: White or gray powdery spots on leaves, stems, and sometimes flowers. Thrives in humid conditions with poor air circulation.
prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure proper spacing. Water at the base of plants. Prune to improve air flow. Avoid overhead watering.
treatment: Remove infected plant parts. Apply fungicides containing sulfur, neem oil, or potassium bicarbonate. Improve air circulation.

symptoms: Roots become brown, mushy, and decayed. Plants may wilt, have stunted growth, and eventually die. Often caused by overwatering or poor drainage.
prevention: Ensure proper drainage. Avoid overwatering. Use well-draining soil. Rotate crops. Remove plant debris.
treatment: Remove affected plants. Improve soil drainage. Apply fungicides containing thiophanate-methyl or azoxystrobin. Reduce watering.

symptoms: Winding, white or brown trails (mines) on leaves as larvae feed between leaf layers. Reduces photosynthesis and can cause leaf drop.
prevention: Use floating row covers. Monitor plants regularly. Remove affected leaves early. Encourage beneficial insects. Practice crop rotation.
treatment: Remove and destroy infested leaves. Apply insecticides containing spinosad or neem oil. Introduce beneficial insects like parasitic wasps.
